thread.title: Greece begins evacuation of 75,000 people after discovery of 500lb WWII bomb
thread.title_full: Greece begins evacuation of 75,000 people after discovery of 500lb WWII bomb | The Independent

author: Will Worley
title: Greece begins evacuation of 75,000 people after discovery of 500lb WWII bomb
text:
A Greek city has begun evacuating around 75,000 people to clear the way for experts to defuse a 500lb unexploded Second World War bomb.
The device was found in Thessaloniki, in the country's north, earlier in February during construction works. It is believed to have been dropped during a 1940s air raid. 
Most of the evacuees will be moved from the western suburb of Kordelio, where a state of emergency has been declared. 
Around 1,000 police officers and 300 volunteers are helping with the evacuation.
More follows...
